poem:
Title: "Elegy for Hi-Tech Tranquility"

In Tokyo, a tour flits and flutters,
Baring secret wonders in heated powder rooms.
A whirl of excitements, in the quietest of murmurs,
Background melodies masking nature's tune.

Yet, in spite of all the chatter and rabble,
They praise the humble latrine for its craft
And a German auteur, amidst this babble,
Finds beauty in what others discard.

Life's constant distractions, so noiseless and near,
In a Perfect Day born from the everyday sphere.
